titles.title: Domestic Violence Shelter Coordination Act of 2001
To authorize grants to States to fund arrangements between local police departments and public accommodations to have the accommodations serve as emergency domestic violence shelters.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 8/1/2001--Introduced. Domestic Violence Shelter Coordination Act of 2001 - Authorizes the Attorney General to make grants to enable States to provide local police departments with funds to pay to have hotels, motels, and other places of public accommodation serve as emergency domestic violence shelters.
